intro: Troximon heterophyllum f. crenulatum, commonly known as the crested or curled-leaved variant of the genus Troximon, is a unique plant characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is notable for its finely divided, crenulate leaves that give it a feathery appearance. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical interest lies in its morphological variation and potential ecological roles within its native habitat.
